core_principles: Fusion over Imitation: Mix Cyberpunk aesthetics with Swiss typography.
Emotion First: The app should feel like a 'Command Center' for your future.
Content is King: Data is the art. Charts and metrics are the heroes.
Negative Space: Use deep black voids to make the neon data pop.
anti_patterns: No default Shadcn cards without customization.
No full-screen gradients (use them as spotlights).
No 'purple/teal' generic AI gradient unless it's electric/neon.

usage_rules.headings: Use 'Outfit' for all H1-H6. Weight: 600 or 700. Tracking: tight (-0.02em).
usage_rules.body: Use 'Plus Jakarta Sans' for all paragraphs and UI text. Weight: 400 or 500.
usage_rules.data: Use 'JetBrains Mono' for skill percentages, code snippets, and match scores.

layout.grid_system: Bento Grid (Mode B for Dashboard, Mode A for Landing)

buttons.animation: Hover: scale-105 transition-transform duration-200. Active: scale-95.

cards.style: Glassmorphism Lite. bg-card/50 backdrop-blur-md border border-white/10.

inputs.style: bg-input/50 border-transparent focus:border-primary focus:ring-1 focus:ring-primary transition-all

charts.style: Minimalist. Hide grid lines where possible. Use gradients for areas.

visual_enhancers.gradients: Use 'Aurora' gradients: subtle moving blobs of primary and accent colors in the background.
visual_enhancers.motion: Staggered entrance for all lists. 'framer-motion' is recommended.

hero_background.alt: Abstract neon data lines representing AI analysis
hero_background.usage: Hero section background with heavy overlay (bg-black/80)

career_test_promo.usage: Side image for the 'Psychological Career Test' section

abstract_data.usage: Background for the 'Skill Gap Results' preview

instructions_to_main_agent.general: You are building a high-end AI SaaS. Do not make it look like a Bootstrap template. Use the provided colors and fonts strictly.
instructions_to_main_agent.file_handling: You are working with .js files. Do not use TypeScript syntax. Ensure all imports are correct for a React + Vite/CRA setup.
instructions_to_main_agent.shadcn: When installing shadcn components, customize the `tailwind.config.js` and `index.css` FIRST with the provided values.
instructions_to_main_agent.layout_strategy: Use the 'Bento Grid' for the dashboard. It should feel dense but organized. Use 'col-span' classes to create variety.
instructions_to_main_agent.animations: Add `framer-motion` for page transitions and component entrances. Everything should feel 'alive'.

UNIVERSAL_GUIDELINES_FOR_MAIN_AGENT: Dark colors look good when used independently without gradients. DO NOT use dark colors as gradients.
Don't make generic centered layouts, simplistic gradients, and uniform styling.
Create depth through layered design elements with z-index hierarchy.
Use glass-morphism effects with backdrop filters (12-24px blur).
You MUST NOT apply universal transition. Eg: `transition: all`. This results in breaking transforms. Always add transitions for specific interactive elements like button, input excluding transforms.
You MUST NOT center align the app container, ie do not add `.App { text-align: center; }` in the css file. This disrupts the human natural reading flow of text.
Always use modern button styles like pill-shaped, or sharp button with interaction animations & color relevant to the app style.
NEVER: use AI assistant Emoji characters like ğŸ¤–ğŸ§ ğŸ’­ğŸ’¡ğŸ”®ğŸ¯ğŸ“šğŸ­ğŸ¬ğŸªğŸ‰ğŸŠğŸğŸ€ğŸ‚ğŸ°ğŸˆğŸ¨ğŸ°ğŸ’°ğŸ’µğŸ’³ğŸ¦ğŸ’ğŸª™ğŸ’¸ğŸ¤‘ğŸ“ŠğŸ“ˆğŸ“‰ğŸ’¹ğŸ”¢ğŸ†ğŸ¥‡ etc for icons.
Every interaction needs micro-animations - hover states, transitions, parallax effects, and entrance animations. Static = dead.
Use 2-3x more spacing than feels comfortable. Cramped designs look cheap.
Subtle grain textures, noise overlays, custom cursors, selection states, and loading animations: separates good from extraordinary.
Main agent relies on these image URLs. Missing categories (especially sponsor logos) = main agent will use placeholder text which is FORBIDDEN.
Prioritize using pre-existing components from src/components/ui when applicable.
Create new components that match the style and conventions of existing components when needed.
Examine existing components to understand the project's component patterns before creating new ones.
Components MUST use named exports (export const ComponentName = ...).
Pages MUST use default exports (export default function PageName() {...}).
Use `sonner` for toasts. Sonner component are located in `/app/src/components/ui/sonner.tsx`.
